verses.name: Psalms 36:1
verses.text: The transgression of the wicked saith within my heart, that there is no fear of God before his eyes.

verses.name: Psalms 36:2
verses.text: For he flattereth himself in his own eyes, until his iniquity be found to be hateful.

verses.name: Psalms 36:3
verses.text: The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit: he hath left off to be wise, and to do good.

verses.name: Psalms 36:4
verses.text: He deviseth mischief upon his bed; he setteth himself in a way that is not good; he abhorreth not evil.

verses.name: Psalms 36:5
verses.text: Thy mercy, O Lord, is in the heavens; and thy faithfulness reacheth unto the clouds.

verses.name: Psalms 36:6
verses.text: Thy righteousness is like the great mountains; thy judgments are a great deep: O Lord, thou preservest man and beast.

verses.name: Psalms 36:7
verses.text: How excellent is thy lovingkindness, O God! therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.

verses.name: Psalms 36:8
verses.text: They shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house; and thou shalt make them drink of the river of thy pleasures.

verses.name: Psalms 36:9
verses.text: For with thee is the fountain of life: in thy light shall we see light.

verses.name: Psalms 36:10
verses.text: O continue thy lovingkindness unto them that know thee; and thy righteousness to the upright in heart.

verses.name: Psalms 36:11
verses.text: Let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of the wicked remove me.

verses.name: Psalms 36:12
verses.text: There are the workers of iniquity fallen: they are cast down, and shall not be able to rise.
